title: Determination of Intracellular Protein Concentration Using a Bright-Field Microscope
content: High density of intracellular proteins creates a very crowded environment, where the volume available to protein molecules becomes limited. This gives rise to macromolecular crowding (MC) effects, which include slower diffusion, formation of protein complexes and oligomers, and driving proteins into more compact shapes [1]. Recent years have seen a surge of interest in MC. Due to high sensitivity of the MC effects to small perturbations in protein concentration, crowding is believed to directly control many biological processes [2].
